thread.title: Pet Events

author: DispatchDaemon
title: Pet Events
text:
Save-A-Life Mobile Adoptions
Oct. 17. Save-A-Life will be holding mobile adoptions at the Abercorn Street Petsmart Store on Oct. 17 from noon to 2:30 p.m. Visit www.savealifepets.org to view the available pets for adoption. Be sure to contact the foster listed to arrange a meet and greet appointment since not all pets come to mobile adoption.
Animal Control fall clinic
The Animal Control Division of Savannah-Chatham Metropolitan Police Department will host its Fall clinic on Oct. 17 from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. The clinic includes microchipping, vaccinations and nail trimming for cats and dogs. DHPP and Bordetella vaccinations for dogs, FVRCP for cats and rabies vaccinations for both are $10 each. Nail cutting for dogs and cat also are $10 each. Microchipping with lifetime registration is available for $20. Payments in the form of cash, checks and money orders will be accepted. Animal Control officers will be on hand to help handle the cats and dogs. All dogs brought to the clinic must be leashed or kenneled. Those prone to biting must be muzzled. Cats must be brought in carriers. The fall clinic will take place at the animal shelter, located at 7211 Sallie Mood Drive. The shelter also will be open at 11 a.m. for pet adoptions. All dog and cat adoption fees have been reduced to $35 until Oct. 31 in celebration of Adopt-A-Shelter Dog Month. Adoptable pets can be viewed in advance at adopt-a-pet.com.
F.A.C.T.S. adoption
Oct. 24. Pet Supermarket, 7805 Chatham Plaza. F.A.C.T.S. Rescue will be at Pet Supermarket for a customer appreciation event. Special adoption fee for fully vetted cats will be $65. Cats range in age from 6 months to adult. Learn more on the group’s Facebook page.
HSGS Drive Through Low Cost Shot Clinic
Nov. 14. The Humane Society of Greater Savannah will hold their Drive Through Low Cost Shot Clinic on Nov. 14 from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. at Chatham Co. Health Department Parking Lot, 1395 Eisenhower Drive. Keeping your dog or cat up-to-date on annual vaccinations that prevent highly contagious and potentially fatal diseases is essential to your pet’s health and well-being. Rabies vaccinations will cost $10 and all others will cost only $15. The following will be available: 1-year Rabies–$10; Bordetella (Kennel Cough)-$15; Da2PPV (Canine Distemper)-$15; FVRCP (Feline Distemper)-$15. Microchips will also be available at $20 each. The line will close to new vehicles at 1:30 p.m. Drivers must enter on the Eisenhower side. No need for you or your pet to even leave your car! To minimize everyone’s wait time, no more than two pets per vehicle are allowed and all cats must be in carriers. Cash is preferred, but credit cards will be accepted. Please note that cars cannot enter the car line until 10 a.m.
Savannah Kennel Club
The Savannah Kennel Club holds an annual dog show and this year the event will take place from Nov. 27–30 at the Savannah Trade & Convention Center. The Savannah Kennel Club was founded in 1935 and we are a non-profit corporation. Throughout the year, the Kennel Club offers community activities such as educational programs, support for the Humane Society fundraisers, and other activities designed to encourage responsible dog ownership. The community education programs are oriented towards dog familiarization and personal safety with dogs. You can visit our website at www.savannahkennelclub.org
One Love Animal Rescue
Volunteers are a vital component of the day-to-day operations of our animal rescue, helping us with everything from the tasks of caring for animals as a foster in your home with all of the animal’s needs supplied by One Love, adoption follow-ups, paperwork behind the scenes, assisting at our fundraising events, and helping raise funds for our vital programs. We have multiple needs and openings for life-saving volunteer opportunities available. Submit a volunteer application online at oneloveanimalrescue.com/volunteer or a foster application at oneloveanimalrescue.com/foster-home-agreement or for more information email info@oneloveanimalrescue.com.
Coastal Pet Rescue seeks help
It’s been a long year for Coastal Pet Rescue, and with 99 canine intakes this year, it’s only going to be longer. So far, Coastal Pet Rescue has treated five canines for heartworms, and two more are still awaiting their turn, but help is urgently needed to fund the medical care. Although heartworms are preventable thanks to monthly medications, many of the dogs Coastal Pet Rescue rescues have not been kept current — if ever at all — on the prevention, and thus need the expensive treatments. Treatments can run $600 to $1200 depending upon the severity of the infestation, and since Coastal Pet Rescue does not believe in passing on the excessive medical bills for adopters and instead charges only a flat $150 adoption fee, there’s a lot left to cover. Donations may be made online at coastalpetrescue.org/donate or by mail to Coastal Pet Rescue, PO Box 30462, Savannah, GA 31410. For more information, contact Lisa Scarbrough at lisa@coastalpetrescue.org.
Save-A-Life Seeks Animal Lovers
Do you like animals? Want to help them but have limited time? Save-A-Life could use your assistance for just a few hours a month. We are seeking volunteers to help with special projects. Most of the projects can be done from your own home and we will provide training. Interested in learning more? Call 912 598-7729 and leave a message for Karen.
Rescue group seeks computer help, fosters
GRRR needs computer savvy volunteers who can transfer paper files to the computer, do flyers, calendars, and revamp our application, surrender, contract, etc. forms. We also desperately need foster homes. These would be temporary loving, safe havens until the dogs can be adopted. We also need heavy, durable blankets to use for beds, i.e. moving blankets. The usual dog beds do not hold up as they are stripped of the fuzz filling inside, and usually ripped to shreds rather quickly. Donations of food (Pedigree canned and Rachel Ray dry) are needed, as well as monetary donations to help offset costs of operations, medicines, toys, food, tags, treats, grooming, etc. For more information, contact 912-656-9792 or go to www.g-r-r-r.com.
Animal rescue volunteers needed
One Love Animal Rescue Inc. is a volunteer based organization located in Savannah. Our mission is to help abandoned, neglected, abused and unwanted pets by partnering with shelters, rescue groups and the community. We operate as a nonprofit organization with no paid staff members, and all donations directly benefit the animals entrusted in our care. We are seeking animal lovers to volunteer, foster or donate to the welfare of these abandoned and neglected pets. Please sign up to volunteer, foster or donate at www.oneloveanimalrescue.com or by calling 912-507-6125. One Love Animal Rescue, Inc. of Savannah, GA is a licensed non-profit 501(c)(3) rescue organization; all donations are tax deductible and directly benefit the animals entrusted in our care.
Become a Humane Society volunteer
Be a part of a life-saving team by volunteering with the Humane Society for Greater Savannah. Foster parenting, behavior enrichment, special events and general TLC are all part of being an HSGS volunteer. Receive your “Success Kit” after completing the necessary training. Your T-shirt, leash, name tag, treat apron and Volunteer Guide will ensure your success in making a difference to each animal you encounter. Apply online at www.humanesocietysav.org/volunteer . For more information, contact Selah Dalacos at 912-354-9515, ext. 112, or sdalacos@humanesocietysav.org.
Pet foster home volunteers needed
Welcome an abandoned or neglected dachshund into your home for 2 weeks to 2 months. You provide food and a safe and loving environment. Dachshund Rescue of North America will approve and pay for needed vetting. You can make a difference in the life of a dachshund by helping a pup become ready for his or her “furever” home. Call Ellen Hatcher at 912-398-1892 or email ellenwh@bellsouth.net to learn more about this meaningful experience. You can make a difference in the life of a dachshund. For more information, go to www.drna.org.
Volunteers and foster homes needed
Volunteers and foster homes needed at Savannah-Chatham Animal Control, 7211 Sallie Mood Drive. Volunteers can walk, bathe, teach and play with the animals at the shelter. Volunteers to assist with the public and for office work also needed. Orientation is required; contact Diane at 912-484-4438.
Dog walks
5 p.m. Canine Palace, 612 Abercorn St. ST. ALMO hosts informal dog walks at 5 p.m. Sundays, weather permitting. Meet at Canine Palace. For information, call 912-234-3336.
Dog Days
4 p.m. Wednesdays, Islands Branch Library, 125 Wilmington Road. Practice your reading skills with one of our furry friends. For children ages 5 and older. For information, call 912-897-6233.
